title: How scientists are using facial-recognition AI to track humpback whales
description: After being hunted for decades, humpback whales returned to the Pacific Ocean in big numbers. Now, new technology is revealing that underwater heat waves are taking a toll on that recovery.

title: New York sues beef producer JBS for 'fraudulent' marketing around climate change
description: New York state Attorney General Letitia James said the food company is misleading the public about its efforts to cut its climate pollution.

title: Scores killed trying to get food from an aid convoy during a chaotic scene in Gaza
description: Health officials in Gaza say over 100 are dead after Israeli troops fired on a crowd that was trying to pull food from the convoy. Israeli officials said the crowd had approached in a threatening way.

title: Tracing the rise of Christian nationalism, from Trump to the Ala. Supreme Court
description: Bradley Onishi is a former Christian nationalist who's now a professor of religion and the author of Preparing for War, a critique of the movement and its impact on American democracy.

title: Florida is releasing Jeffrey Epstein's grand jury report
description: Jeffrey Epstein was a wealthy financier, who was charged with paying dozens of underage women over many years for sex. He died in a jail cell in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges.

title: Relatives in Lebanon mourn victims of Israeli strikes, including a 5-year-old girl
description: Photographer Diego Ibarra Sánchez accompanied mourners in southern Lebanon after Israel stepped up airstrikes that claimed the lives of civilians and Hezbollah fighters.

title: The human cost of climate-related disasters is acutely undercounted, new study says
description: A new study counts the human health costs from increasingly costly and dangerous extreme weather in the U.S.

title: SCOTUS takes on Trump immunity case; Gaza death toll surpasses 30,000
description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments in the Trump immunity case in April. More than 30,000 people have been killed in Gaza since October.

title: A story of Jewish Shanghai, told through music
description: A fictional tale of the real-life Jewish community in Shanghai during World War II — with a cross-cultural love story at its heart — is premiering at the New York Philharmonic on Thursday.

title: Biden and Trump are both at the border today, staking out ground on a key 2024 issue
description: President Biden is trying to go on the offensive on migration, an issue that is a big liability this year. He's visiting the Texas border on the same day as former President Donald Trump.

title: 'Message has been received': Biden's campaign reacts to 'uncommitted' votes
description: In Michigan, a push to encourage voters to send President Biden a message about his refusal to call for a permanent cease-fire in Gaza may have worked. Here's how his campaign moves forward.

title: The Transportation Department proposes new rules for how airlines handle wheelchairs
description: Travelers who use wheelchairs complain that airlines often damage or lose them. Now the Biden administration is proposing new standards for how airlines accommodate passengers with disabilities.

title: ExxonMobil is suing investors who want faster climate action
description: The oil and gas giant is suing investor groups that want it to slash climate pollution. Interest groups on both sides of the case say it could lead to more lawsuits against activist investors.

title: Field Notes: On Reporting, the Israel-Hamas War
description: The first in a two-part special series featuring conversations between Embedded host Kelly McEvers and NPR reporters who have been on the ground during the current conflict in Gaza. In the first episode, NPR's Daniel Estrin talks about the challenges of reporting on the Israel-Hamas war and the work of his colleague Anas Baba from inside Gaza.

title: Family Dollar is fined over $40 million due to a rodent infestation in its warehouse
description: The Food and Drug Administration found dead and live rodents, and their feces and urine. More than 1,200 rodents were exterminated after fumigation at the warehouse, which serves more than 400 stores.

title: Can Speaker Of The House Mike Johnson Make A Deal?
description:
Despite a last minute agreement to push a deadline for a shutdown, Congress and the White House have to agree on how to fund the government. So far, all they've been able to do is kick the can down the road.

And conditions for making a political deal are only getting worse. Republicans can only lose two votes. And there's skepticism all around.

Finding a way out largely depends on Speaker of the House Mike Johnson, Republican of Louisiana. But Johnson has a fractious caucus, is relatively inexperienced, and shutdowns have become the political weapon of choice.

If the House leader can't find a path to a deal, the entire country could pay the price.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

title: Ghana's parliament passes anti-LGBTQ+ bill that could imprison people for years
description: The bill criminalizes members of the LGBTQ+ community as well as its supporters, including promotion and funding of related activities and public displays of affection.
